comment: It often happens in the Nimzo Indian that Black has to concede the Bishop pair to his opponent. In return he usually has the (temporary) control of the crucial square e4, and so can give a half-closed character to the position. In the present game, Black lacks this compensation, and this is why White can rapidly go over to the attack
reasoning: The comment accurately describes a common tactical error in the Nimzo-Indian defense, suggesting a loss of initiative and a potential for a quick attack.
